reg:regulation.reg:title: Use of Electronic Devices While Driving Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Motor Vehicle Act;
Class 7 means a Class 7 driver's licence described in section 30.01 (2) (c) of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58;
Class 7L means a Class 7L driver's licence described in section 30.01 (2) (d) of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58;
commercial motor vehicle has the same meaning as in section 37.01 of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58;
electronic logging device or ELD has the same meaning as in section 37.01 of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who watches the screen of an electronic device uses the device for the purposes of paragraph (d) of the definition of "use" in section 214.1 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following electronic devices are prescribed for the purposes of paragraph (c) of the definition of "electronic device" in section 214.1 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: electronic devices that include a hands-free telephone function;
electronic logging devices;
global positioning systems;
hand-held electronic devices, one of the purposes of which is to process or compute data;
hand-held audio players;
hand microphones;
televisions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (1), hand microphone means a communication device consisting of a hand-held unit that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is both receiver and microphone,
is operated by a push and hold-to-talk function, and
allows for oral communication, but not for the transmission and receipt of oral communication at the same time.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to sections 7 (1) (a) and 8 (3), an electronic device listed in subsection (2) must be installed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: so that it is securely fixed to the motor vehicle, and
in a manner that does not obstruct the driver's view of the front or sides of the motor vehicle or interfere with the safety or operating equipment of the motor vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following electronic devices are listed for the purposes of subsection (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: global positioning systems;
electronic devices that include a hands-free telephone function;
televisions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Persons carrying out powers, duties or functions
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 214.5 (a) of the Act, the following classes of persons may use an electronic device while exercising their powers, duties or functions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person appointed under section 11 of the Canada Border Services Agency Act to conduct intelligence, investigation or enforcement work of the agency in the Intelligence Division, the Criminal Investigators Division or the Pacific Region Enforcement Centre;
a person designated as a park warden under section 18 of the National Parks Act;
a sheriff, in the discharge of the sheriff's duties under the Sheriff Act, while transporting a person in the lawful custody of a sheriff.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Persons engaged in prescribed activity — commercial motor vehicle with ELD
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 214.5 (b) of the Act, a person who is driving or operating a commercial motor vehicle, if the commercial motor vehicle is equipped with an electronic logging device that is mounted in accordance with section 37.39 (1) (b) of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58, is engaged in a prescribed activity and the person is exempt from the prohibition in section 214.2 of the Act in respect of the use of the electronic logging device.
Sections 7 to 10 of this regulation do not apply to a person driving or operating a motor vehicle under a Class 7 or 7L licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 6 and subsection (2), a person may use an electronic device in a hands-free telephone function while driving or operating a motor vehicle on a highway, if the device

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is installed in accordance with section 4 and within easy reach of the driver's seat, or worn securely on the person's body,
is voice-activated or requires only one touch in order to initiate, accept or end a call, and
in the case of a device that includes an earpiece, the earpiece is worn only in one ear.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (c) does not apply to a person who is driving or operating a motorcycle on a highway.
Subject to section 6 and subsection (3), a person may use a global positioning system for navigation purposes while driving or operating a motor vehicle on a highway, if the system is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: installed in accordance with section 4 if subsection (3) of this section does not apply, and
operated in accordance with this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person may use a global positioning system while driving or operating a motor vehicle on a highway, if the system

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is programmed before the person begins to drive or operate the motor vehicle, or
can be programmed in a voice-activated manner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a global positioning system is a hand-held type, a person may use the system while driving or operating a motor vehicle on a highway if, in addition to the requirements of subsection (2), the system

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is not held in the person's hand, and

is securely fixed to the motor vehicle in a manner that does not obstruct the person's view of the front or sides of the motor vehicle or interfere with the safety or operating equipment of the motor vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 6, a person may use a hand microphone while driving or operating a motor vehicle on a highway if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the device is within easy reach of the driver's seat, and

is securely fixed to the motor vehicle or worn securely on the person's body in a manner that does not obstruct the person's view of the front or sides of the motor vehicle or interfere with the safety or operating equipment of the motor vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 6, a person may use a hand-held audio player while driving or operating a motor vehicle on a highway if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the device

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is not held in the person's hand, and

is securely fixed to the motor vehicle or worn securely on the person's body in a manner that does not obstruct the person's view of the front or sides of the motor vehicle or interfere with the safety or operating equipment of the motor vehicle, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sound is emitted through the speakers of the sound system of the motor vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Except as provided in subsection (2), a person must not drive or operate a motor vehicle on a highway in which the image displayed from a television in the vehicle is visible to the person.

Subsection (1) does not apply if the image on the television displays pictures, information or data solely designed to assist the driver in the safe operation of the vehicle or the safety and security of its load or its passengers.
The exception in subsection (2) does not apply to a person driving or operating a motor vehicle under a Class 7 or 7L licence.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Motor Vehicle Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 318, ss. 25, 210, 214.5 and 214.6.]
